title: IAG cuts 2019 guidance due to British Airways strikes
text:
International Consolidated Airlines Group S.A. on Thursday said it expects adjusted operating profit for 2019 to be below that of 2018 due to recent strikes at British Airways.

The airline group IAG, -3.94% said it expects adjusted operating profit----a measure of performance that strips out exceptional items, acquisition costs and amortization of intangible assets--to be 215 million euros ($236 million) lower than 2018’s pro forma EUR3.49 billion.

The company said the impact of the strikes is estimated to be EUR137 million and that further disruption affected British Airways with a net financial impact of EUR33 million.

IAG said the latest booking trends in its low-cost segment will also have an adverse financial impact of EUR45 million.

The group said any further industrial action will affect the company’s full-year operating profit.
